Package gw.api.webservice

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    DataObjectAPIImpl
    FieldFilter
    A FieldFilter represents a mapping from an entity name to an array of field names. To see how it is used, see {@link ObjectFilter}.
    IFieldFilter  
    IInsertPathValue  
    IPathValue  
    ObjectFilter
    An ObjectFilter, given a graph of objects, will extract a subgraph of "interesting" objects. It is designed to be used in places such as webservices where returning a large graph of objects may lead to performance problems.

    At a lower level, an ObjectFilter represents a set of rules which are applied recursively to a object (which we will call the "root object"). Each ObjectFilter consists of an array of {@link FieldFilter} objects, and each {@link FieldFilter} object defines a one-to-many relation from an entity name to a list of field names. The graph described by a given ObjectFilter and root object is calculated using the following algorithm:

    Find the entity name for the current object.

    Look through the ObjectFilter for a {@link FieldFilter} whose entity name correponds to the entity name of the current object.

    If there is no such {@link FieldFilter}, set every property of the current object to null. object.

    Take the {@link FieldFilter} with the matching entity name (if there is more than one such {@link FieldFilter}, choose one of them arbitrarily)

    Fetch the list of field names from the {@link FieldFilter}

    Set each field on the current object to null unless the field's name appears in the {@link FieldFilter}'s list of field names.

    Recursively apply this procedure to each object which is a property of the current object.

    Applying this procedure to the root object yields the directed graph.
    UserAPIHelper
